backend/main.mo: Main backend actor implementing access control, user approval, invite-only mode, user profiles, and match management (APA practice, Accepting Gifts, Straight Shot, official APA matches) with CRUD operations and query endpoints.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting four completed features related to removing the 'Best 10 of last 20' checkbox, modifying getFilteredMatches, adding getMatchOutcomeAndPpi helper, and updating record/win rate calculations in matchup analysis components.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend files including pages, components, and utilities, describing authentication, game modes, match history, stats, and UI patterns with specific implementation details.
frontend/docs/v48-modecard-resume-button: Documentation for a UI-only change in ModeCard component that reorders buttons to show 'Start New Game' above 'Resume Game' without affecting any session storage, navigation, or gameplay logic.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes, defining colors for backgrounds, foregrounds, borders, charts, and sidebar components using oklch color space.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with viewport meta tag, title describing the app as an APA-style pool practice scorekeeper, and script tag loading the React application from main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root application component configuring TanStack Router with all routes (home, game modes, history, stats, admin), ThemeProvider, AuthGate wrapper, Toaster, and error boundaries with RouteErrorFallback for all routes.
frontend/src/components/accepting-gifts/: Table component displaying Accepting Gifts performance statistics grouped by starting ball count (2-7), showing wins and losses for each level with empty state handling.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaBallButto: A button component representing a pool ball (1-9) with different visual states (unscored, playerA, playerB, dead) and displays ball number with appropriate styling and accessibility labels.
frontend/src/components/apa/apaBallStyle: Defines ball state types, value calculations, and rack total calculations for APA 9-ball scoring, including the one-away 9-ball rule where the 9-ball counts as 1 point instead of 2 when a player needs exactly 1 point to win.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaRackScori: Interactive panel for scoring a single rack in APA 9-ball, tracking ball states, defensive shots, innings per player, and handling auto-dead ball logic when match completion is imminent or 9-ball is pocketed.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaResultsSu: Displays final match results showing both players' statistics (skill level, points, defensive shots, innings, PPI) with winner highlighted and team match points outcome.
frontend/src/components/apa/MatchupAnaly: Dropdown menu component that extracts unique opponent names from official APA matches and allows selection for matchup analysis.
Enhanced matchup analysis dropdown with toggle for including practice matches, filters matches by opponent name, and displays MatchupAnalysisPanel when opponent is selected.
Panel displaying head-to-head statistics against a specific opponent, aggregating both official and practice APA matches with win/loss records and PPI calculations.
frontend/src/components/apa/RealApaMatch: Form component for creating or editing official APA match records with fields for opponent details, scores, innings, defensive shots, and validation against skill-level-based point targets.
frontend/src/components/apa/useApaInning: React hook managing APA inning flow state, tracking active player, shared innings count, and ball scoring status with logic to increment innings only when Player B's turn ends.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthGate.ts: Authentication gate component that checks Internet Identity login status, invite-only mode, and user approval/admin status before rendering protected content or showing login/access-denied screens.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Login/logout button component using Internet Identity that handles authentication state, clears query cache on logout, and manages error recovery for duplicate authentication attempts.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Dialog component for creating and editing user profiles with name and APA skill level fields, automatically opening for new users and providing connection retry functionality when backend actor is unavailable.
frontend/src/components/history/MatchHis: Table component displaying match history with multi-select checkboxes, bulk delete functionality, and columns for date, match results narrative, PPI, aPPI, and action buttons with navigation to match details.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: Main application layout with sticky header containing logo, navigation buttons (stats, admin), profile setup, login/logout, connection status indicator, and footer with Caffeine.ai attribution.
frontend/src/components/matches/DeleteMa: Confirmation dialog button for deleting a single match with AlertDialog UI, mutation handling, and navigation to history page or custom callback after deletion.
frontend/src/components/matches/EndMatch: A reusable alert dialog component for confirming match termination with customizable title, description, and confirm text, supporting pending and disabled states.
frontend/src/components/matches/MatchSum: Displays a summary card for a match with mode badge, date, and mode-specific details (APA scores, Accepting Gifts status, Straight Shot results), with navigation to match details.
frontend/src/components/navigation/ModeC: A card component for game mode selection that displays title, description, icon, and buttons to start new or resume in-progress sessions.
frontend/src/components/players/ApaAggre: Renders line charts for APA performance trends including PPI/aPPI, points scored, and defensive shots over time using Recharts with custom dot shapes.
frontend/src/components/straight-shot/St: Displays a bar chart histogram showing the frequency distribution of shot counts for Straight Shot sessions.
Renders a table summarizing Straight Shot performance by ball count, showing wins, losses, and first win date for each ball count.
Displays a composed chart with bars and trend line showing shot count over time for Straight Shot sessions, including average calculation.
frontend/src/dev/straight-shot-spot-chec: QA checklist document for manually verifying Straight Shot (20-shot game) functionality remains intact after code changes, covering session start, shot entry, save, and history viewing.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and manages the backend actor instance based on Internet Identity authentication state, invalidating dependent queries on actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useActorRetry.ts: Hook providing a retry mechanism for actor initialization by clearing cached actor queries and triggering refetch without page refresh.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: React hook and provider for Internet Identity authentication on ICP, managing login state, identity persistence, and delegation validation with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for backend operations including match CRUD, user profiles, AG level management, and user approval workflows with automatic cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light/dark theme color tokens including primary, secondary, muted, destructive, and sidebar colors.
frontend/src/lib/accepting-gifts/accepti: Defines the 12-level Accepting Gifts progression system (2+8 through 7+9) with helpers for level clamping, max attempts, and baseline level computation based on win/loss outcomes.
Manages Accepting Gifts game session state including attempt tracking, scoring logic (player vs ghost), and set progression for race-to-7 format.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaAggregateStats.t: Extracts and aggregates APA match statistics (PPI, aPPI, points, defensive shots) from both practice and official matches with independent field validation and null handling.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaEqualizer.ts: Defines APA 9-Ball skill level to points-to-win mapping (SL1=14 through SL9=75) with validation and formatting utilities.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaMatchPoints.ts: Implements APA 9-Ball 20-point match outcome conversion system based on loser's skill level and points pocketed, with threshold tables for each skill level.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaPracticeMatchOut: Computes APA Practice match outcomes by determining the winner based on target scores, then using the loser's skill level and points to calculate match points for both players.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaScoring.ts: Handles APA 9-ball rack scoring with 10 points per rack, validates rack totals, and calculates PPI (points per inning) statistics for players across multiple racks.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaSkillLevelPredic: Predicts APA skill levels (1-9) from PPI and aPPI averages using different range tables for Official APA Tab and Detailed Player Stats pages.
frontend/src/lib/apa/officialApaExpected: Provides the official APA expected PPI lookup table organized by win percentage buckets (10-100%) and skill levels (SL2-SL7) for performance evaluation.
Derives Official APA match outcomes (win/loss/unknown) by comparing player scores against their skill-level-based target scores, with fallback to stored didWin field.
frontend/src/lib/apa/officialApaPpi.ts: Calculates Official APA PPI (score divided by effective innings) and aPPI (adjusted PPI using expected PPI table for wins, raw PPI for losses) with win percentage context from last 20 matches.
frontend/src/lib/history/matchHistoryRow: Builds formatted narrative strings for match history rows, displaying mode-specific results (Official APA, APA Practice, Straight Shots, Accepting Gifts) with scores and win/loss indicators.
frontend/src/lib/matches/effectiveMatchD: Determines the effective match timestamp for sorting by preferring user-entered dates for Official APA matches and falling back to system dateTime, with local timezone-aware parsing for YYYY-MM-DD format.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuilders.t: Exports buildOfficialApaMatchLog function that creates official APA match records with derived win/loss outcomes based on skill levels and scores, plus re-exports other match builders from matchBuildersOriginal.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuildersOr: Contains builder functions for APA 9-ball practice matches, Accepting Gifts matches, and Straight Shot matches, each generating structured match records with player stats, scores, and outcomes.
frontend/src/lib/session/inProgressSessi: Provides centralized helpers for managing per-mode in-progress session state in sessionStorage, with separate keys for APA Practice, Accepting Gifts, and Straight Shot modes.
frontend/src/lib/stats/acceptingGiftsPer: Computes Accepting Gifts performance statistics grouped by starting ball count (2-7), tracking wins and losses from completed race-to-7 sets.
frontend/src/lib/stats/acceptingGiftsSta: Calculates summary statistics for Accepting Gifts mode including total sessions and rolling average of ending object ball counts from the last N sessions.
Computes official APA match statistics including win rate, average PPI from last 10 matches, and average aPPI from best 10 of last 20 matches.
frontend/src/lib/stats/straightShotStats: Calculates comprehensive Straight Shot statistics including rolling/lifetime averages, lowest shot count, trend data, histogram data, and win/loss summary by ball count.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React root with QueryClient, InternetIdentityProvider, and renders the main App component.
frontend/src/pages/accepting-gifts/Accep: Main game page for the Accepting Gifts drill, managing live game state (level progression, set scoring, attempts) with session persistence, end-match dialog, and backend save functionality.
Displays the rules and objectives for the Accepting Gifts drill, explaining the 12-level progression system, match format (race to 7), and win/loss progression logic.
Start page for Accepting Gifts drill allowing users to select a starting level, view rules, and start or resume a session with confirmation dialogs for overwriting in-progress sessions.
Live scoring page for APA 9-ball practice matches, tracking racks, points, innings, and defensive shots with session persistence and match completion handling.
frontend/src/pages/apa/PracticeStartPage: Setup page for APA practice matches where users enter player names, skill levels (with auto-loading from profile), and notes, with validation to prevent duplicate player names.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchEditP: Edit page for official APA match logs, loading existing match data by ID and rendering the RealApaMatchForm in edit mode with navigation back to match details.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchPlace: Entry page for creating official APA match logs after the fact (non-live scoring), rendering the RealApaMatchForm in create mode.
frontend/src/pages/auth/AccessNotAllowed: Displays an access denied page for invite-only apps with a button to request approval from the owner. Shows success confirmation after request submission.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchDetailsP: Shows detailed information for a single match including player stats, scores, and mode-specific details (APA practice, official APA, gifts, or straight shot). Includes navigation to player aggregate stats and match editing/deletion.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchHistoryP: Displays a filterable list of all matches with tabs for different game modes (All, APA, Gifts, Straight) and toggleable views (cards or table). Supports sorting by date and navigation back to home or stats.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Main landing page displaying four mode cards (Official APA Match Log, APA Practice, Accepting Gifts, Straight Shot) with navigation to match history for authenticated users.
frontend/src/pages/owner/OwnerApprovalsP: Admin-only page for managing user access approvals with invite-only mode toggle. Displays pending, approved, and rejected users with actions to approve/reject individually or reject all pending requests.
frontend/src/pages/players/PlayerAggrega: Shows aggregate APA statistics for a specific player including win rate, best 10 of 20 PPI/aPPI averages, and predicted skill levels. Includes matchup analysis dropdown for comparing performance against opponents.
frontend/src/pages/SmokeCheckPage.tsx: Deployment verification page with a checklist and quick navigation buttons to test routing to Home and Match History pages.
frontend/src/pages/stats/StatsPage.tsx: Main statistics dashboard with tabs for different game modes (APA, Straight Shot, Accepting Gifts) showing charts, trends, and performance metrics. Includes matchup analysis panel and navigation to detailed player stats and match history.
frontend/src/pages/straight-shot/Straigh: Main game page for Straight Shot drill that manages game state (player name, notes, total shots), handles session persistence via sessionStorage, and provides UI for recording shots and ending/saving the session with backend integration.
Displays the rules and objectives for the Straight Shot drill, explaining that players must clear all balls in 20 shots or fewer with the 8-ball pocketed last.

Start page for Straight Shot drill that displays moving average statistics from recent matches, allows starting new sessions or resuming in-progress sessions, and shows confirmation dialogs when overwriting existing sessions.
frontend/src/utils/errorText.ts: Utility function that extracts readable error messages from various error types (strings, Error objects, nested objects) with fallback handling for unknown error formats.
frontend/src/utils/playerName.ts: Provides utility functions for normalizing and comparing player names case-insensitively, including checking if a name matches any in a list.
frontend/src/utils/playerRoutes.ts: Helper function that builds URL-encoded route paths for player aggregate stats pages.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Comprehensive URL parameter utilities for extracting query parameters from both regular and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage persistence and parameter cleanup functions.
frontend/src/utils/withTimeout.ts: Wraps a Promise with a timeout mechanism that rejects if the operation doesn't complete within the specified time limit.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom color schemes using OKLCH color space, container settings, border radius variables, animations, and plugin integrations for typography and container queries.
project_state.json: Project metadata tracking architectural notes about matchup analysis PPI calculations, practice match handling, and completed features related to removing checkboxes and implementing dual PPI average displays (Last 10 and Best 10 of last 20).
